Pertumbuhan Ekonomi Indonesia 2020 Terancam di Bawah 5 Persen
07 Nov 2019, 11:10 by Tia Dwitiani Komalasari
JAKARTA, (PR).- Pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia tahun 2020 terancam berada di bawah lima persen di tengah perlambatan global yang terjadi saat ini. Investasi menjadi salah satu penentu jika pemerintah ingin menahan laju perlambatan ekonomi tersebut.
Ekonom sekaligus Lead Adviser Prospera, Anton Hermanto Gunawan, mengatakan arah pertumbuhan ekonomi global cenderung masih flat atau sedikit melambat. Kondisi itu berpengaruh pada pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia.
Menurut Anton, perlambatan ekonomi global itu bisa menekan pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia hingga berada di bawah lima persen pada 2020. Beberapa sektor yang masih mengalami kontraksi adalah industri manufaktur dan pertambangan. 
"Kecuali industri makanan dan minuman karena itu pun terbantu oleh CPO. Namun tambang dan hasil tambang harga komoditasnya cenderung turun. Begitu juga di kelompok perdagangan besar dan retail,"ujarnya.
Meskipun demikian, menurut Anton, perlambatan ekonomi tersebut tidak akan terlalu tajam. "Saya gak percaya kalau (pertumbuham ekonomi) Indonesia dikatakan bisa mencapai 4 atau 4,5 %. Kalau di bawah pun, angkanya masih mendekati 5%," kata dia.
Selain itu, Anton mengatakan, prediksi itu belum memasukan faktor sentimen investasi dan bisnis. Seperti diketahui sebelummya banyak investor dan pelaku bisnis yang masih menunggu perkembangan politik domestik. 
"Kondisi politik saat pemilu yang bertentangan membuat investor dan pelaku bisnis wait and see. Sekarang kan fokus Presiden Jokowi di kabinet kedua adalah stabilitas politik," tuturnya.
Selain stabilitas politik, menurut Anton, pemerintah juga perlu melakukan reformasi kebijakan untuk menarik investor. "Jika investasi naik misalnya saja 8 persen, itu bisa meningkatkan pertumbuhan ekonomi hingga menjadi 5,1 atau 5,2 %. Jadi yang terpenting adalah sejauh mana stabilitas politik dan reformasi kebijakan dapat mempengaruhi pertumbuhan investasi," tuturnya.
Di tempat terpisah, Menteri Perekonomian Airlangga Hartarto mengatakan pemerintah tengah merancang Program Prioritas dan Program Kerja 2020-2024 di bidang perekonomian. Terdapat empat kelompok yang disasar dalam program tersebut.
Program mendorong pertumbuhan ekonomi
Pertama adalah program untuk mendorong pertumbuhan ekonomi. Kedua adalah program untuk meningkatkan pemerataan ekonomi dan pengurangan kesenjangan (Inklusif). Ketiga, program untuk mendukung keberlanjutan ekonomi (Sustainability). Keempat, program untuk meningkatkan daya saing ekonomi (Competitiveness).
“Rapat hari ini adalah langkah awal untuk koordinasi dan sinkronisasi kerangka pikir dari program yang selaras antara Kementerian Koordinator Bidang Perekonomian dengan Kementerian/Lembaga di lingkup perekonomian,” ujar Airlangga.
Dia mengatakan, ada 15 usulan Program Prioritas (Quick Wins) yang diharapkan tuntas dalam 6 bulan ke depan. “Sebelumnya Presiden RI sudah mengatakan bahwa 6 bulan pertama yang akan menentukan kondisi ekonomi kita. Tantangan kita adalah apakah kita bisa menangani persoalan-persoalan yang timbul di tengah perekonomian yang slow down,” kata Airlangga. 
Adapun program prioritas tersebut antara lain program Implementasi Mandatori B30, Perbaikan Ekosistem Ketenagakerjaan, Jaminan Produk Halal (JPH), Penelitian dan Pengembangan Industri Farmasi, dan Penguatan Trans Pacific Petrochemical Indotama (TPPI). 
Ada pula mengenai perbaikan Kebijakan Kredit Usaha Rakyat (KUR), Penerapan Kartu Pra Kerja, Pengembangan Kawasan Batam, Bintan, dan Karimun (BBK), Gasifikasi Batubara, Pengembangan Hortikultura Berorientasi Ekspor, Kemitraan Pertanian Berbasis Teknologi, Percepatan Elektronifikasi Keuangan Daerah, Green Refinery, dan Omnibus Law Cipta Kerja.***

Indonesia's Economic Growth in 2020 Threatened Under 5 Percent
Nov 7 2019, 11:10 by Tia Dwitiani Komalasari
JAKARTA, (PR) .- Indonesia's economic growth in 2020 is threatened to be under five percent amid the current global slowdown. Investment is one of the determinants if the government wants to put a halt to the economic slowdown.
Economist and Prospera Lead Adviser, Anton Hermanto Gunawan, said the direction of global economic growth tends to remain flat or slow down a bit. This condition affects Indonesia's economic growth.
According to Anton, the slowdown in the global economy could reduce Indonesia's economic growth to below five percent by 2020. Some sectors that are still experiencing contraction are the manufacturing and mining industries.
"Except for the food and beverage industry because it was also helped by CPO. But mining and mining products prices tend to fall. Likewise in large trade and retail groups," he said.
Nevertheless, according to Anton, the economic slowdown will not be too sharp. "I do not believe that (economic growth) Indonesia is said to have reached 4 or 4.5%. Even below, the figure is still close to 5%," he said.
In addition, Anton said, the prediction did not include investment and business sentiment factors. As is known beforehand many investors and business people are still waiting for the development of domestic politics.
"Political conditions during conflicting elections have made investors and business people wait and see. Now President Jokowi's focus in the second cabinet is political stability," he said.
In addition to political stability, according to Anton, the government also needs to make policy reforms to attract investors. "If investment rises for example by 8 percent, it can increase economic growth to 5.1 or 5.2%. So the most important thing is the extent to which political stability and policy reform can affect investment growth," he said.
Separately, Economy Minister Airlangga Hartarto said the government was designing the 2020-2024 Priority Program and Work Program in the economic field. There are four groups targeted in the program.
The program encourages economic growth
First is a program to encourage economic growth. Second is a program to improve economic equality and reduce inequality (inclusive). Third, programs to support economic sustainability (Sustainability). Fourth, programs to improve economic competitiveness (Competitiveness).
"Today's meeting is the first step to coordinating and synchronizing the mindset of a program that is aligned between the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs and Ministries / Institutions in the economic sphere," Airlangga said.
He said, there were 15 Priority Program (Quick Wins) proposals that were expected to be completed within the next 6 months. "Earlier the President of the Republic of Indonesia had said that the first 6 months would determine our economic conditions. Our challenge is whether we can handle the problems that arise in the midst of a slow down economy, "Airlangga said.
The priority programs include the Implementation of the Mandatory B30 program, the Improvement of the Employment Ecosystem, Halal Product Guarantee (JPH), Pharmaceutical Industry Research and Development, and the Strengthening of the Trans Pacific Petrochemical Indotama (TPPI).
There are also improvements to the People's Business Credit Policy (KUR), Application of Pre-Work Cards, Batam, Bintan, and Karimun (BBK) Areas, Coal Gasification, Export-Oriented Horticulture Development, Technology-Based Agricultural Partnerships, Accelerated Regional Financial Electronification, Green Refinery, and Omnibus Law Cipta Karya. ***
